definition: knife-shaved noodles (pared or shaved into strips), a Shanxi specialty
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
surname Dao
to peel with a knife/to pare/to cut (a ball at tennis etc)
to pare/to reduce/to remove/Taiwan pr. [xue4]
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: He said that his nickname is "Toshomen, " you want to know her?
sentences.chinese: 他说自己的外号是“刀削面”，你想认识她吗？

sentences.english: And slippery shaved noodles are the most popular of Shanxi's noodles.
sentences.chinese: 口感溜滑的刀削面是山西最受欢迎的面条。

sentences.english: This shows of noodles in datong charm really amazing.
sentences.chinese: 由此可见刀削面在大同的魅力真的令人叹为观止。

sentences.english: I got to make sliced noodles in Taiyuan.
Myeong-dong's most famous food is fried pork chop and sliced noodles.
sentences.chinese: 明洞最有名的食品是炸猪扒和刀削面。

definition: liangpi (noodle-like dish)
braised noodles/stewed noodles
beef noodle soup

to make noodles by pulling out dough/hand-pulled noodles
pulled noodles/ramen
large round baked wheat pancake
cold noodles

noodles

noodles either made of buckwheat or sorghum
noodles served with soy sauce/sesame butter etc

zha jiang mian: ground pork simmered with salty fermented soybean paste (or other sauce) over thick wheat noodles
